144     FileStatus[] entries = fs.listStatus(new Path("/"));
145     flushToConsole("Num entries in /:" + entries.length);
146     for (FileStatus dir : entries){
147       assertTrue("Deleting " + dir.getPath(),
148           fs.delete(dir.getPath(), true));
149     }
150     // create the HLog directory because recursive log creates are not allowed

166   @Test 
167   public void testRecoveredEditsPathForMeta() throws IOException {
168     FileSystem fs = FileSystem.get(TEST_UTIL.getConfiguration());
169     byte [] encoded = HRegionInfo.FIRST_META_REGIONINFO.getEncodedNameAsBytes();
170     Path tdir = new Path(hbaseDir, Bytes.toString(HConstants.META_TABLE_NAME));
171     Path regiondir = new Path(tdir,
172         HRegionInfo.FIRST_META_REGIONINFO.getEncodedName());
173     fs.mkdirs(regiondir);
174     long now = System.currentTimeMillis();
175     HLog.Entry entry =
176         new HLog.Entry(new HLogKey(encoded,
177             HConstants.META_TABLE_NAME, 1, now, HConstants.DEFAULT_CLUSTER_ID),
178       new WALEdit());
179     Path p = HLogSplitter.getRegionSplitEditsPath(fs, entry, hbaseDir, true);
180     String parentOfParent = p.getParent().getParent().getName();
181     assertEquals(parentOfParent, HRegionInfo.FIRST_META_REGIONINFO.getEncodedName());
182   }

184   /**
185    * Test old recovered edits file doesn't break HLogSplitter.
186    * This is useful in upgrading old instances.
187    */
188   @Test 
189   public void testOldRecoveredEditsFileSidelined() throws IOException {
190     FileSystem fs = FileSystem.get(TEST_UTIL.getConfiguration());
191     byte [] encoded = HRegionInfo.FIRST_META_REGIONINFO.getEncodedNameAsBytes();
192     Path tdir = new Path(hbaseDir, Bytes.toString(HConstants.META_TABLE_NAME));
193     Path regiondir = new Path(tdir,
194         HRegionInfo.FIRST_META_REGIONINFO.getEncodedName());
195     fs.mkdirs(regiondir);
196     long now = System.currentTimeMillis();
197     HLog.Entry entry =
198         new HLog.Entry(new HLogKey(encoded,
199             HConstants.META_TABLE_NAME, 1, now, HConstants.DEFAULT_CLUSTER_ID),
200       new WALEdit());
201     Path parent = HLog.getRegionDirRecoveredEditsDir(regiondir);
202     assertEquals(parent.getName(), HLog.RECOVERED_EDITS_DIR);
203     fs.createNewFile(parent); // create a recovered.edits file 
204 
205     Path p = HLogSplitter.getRegionSplitEditsPath(fs, entry, hbaseDir, true);
206     String parentOfParent = p.getParent().getParent().getName();
207     assertEquals(parentOfParent, HRegionInfo.FIRST_META_REGIONINFO.getEncodedName());
208     HLog.createWriter(fs, p, conf);
209   }

231   @Test
232   public void testSplitPreservesEdits() throws IOException{
233     final String REGION = "region__1";
234     regions.removeAll(regions);
235     regions.add(REGION);
236 
237     generateHLogs(1, 10, -1);
238     fs.initialize(fs.getUri(), conf);
239     HLogSplitter logSplitter = HLogSplitter.createLogSplitter(conf,
240       hbaseDir, hlogDir, oldLogDir, fs);
241     logSplitter.splitLog();
242 
243     Path originalLog = (fs.listStatus(oldLogDir))[0].getPath();
244     Path splitLog = getLogForRegion(hbaseDir, TABLE_NAME, REGION);
245 
246     assertEquals("edits differ after split", true, logsAreEqual(originalLog, splitLog));
247   }

252 
253     injectEmptyFile(".empty", true);
254     generateHLogs(Integer.MAX_VALUE);
255     injectEmptyFile("empty", true);
256 
257     // make fs act as a different client now
258     // initialize will create a new DFSClient with a new client ID
259     fs.initialize(fs.getUri(), conf);

269     }

353   @Test
354   public void testMiddleGarbageCorruptionSkipErrorsReadsHalfOfFile() throws IOException {
355     conf.setBoolean(HBASE_SKIP_ERRORS, true);
356     generateHLogs(Integer.MAX_VALUE);
357     corruptHLog(new Path(hlogDir, HLOG_FILE_PREFIX + "5"),
358             Corruptions.INSERT_GARBAGE_IN_THE_MIDDLE, false, fs);
359     fs.initialize(fs.getUri(), conf);
360     HLogSplitter logSplitter = HLogSplitter.createLogSplitter(conf,
361         hbaseDir, hlogDir, oldLogDir, fs);
362     logSplitter.splitLog();
363 
364     for (String region : regions) {
365       Path logfile = getLogForRegion(hbaseDir, TABLE_NAME, region);
366       // the entries in the original logs are alternating regions
367       // considering the sequence file header, the middle corruption should
368       // affect at least half of the entries
369       int goodEntries = (NUM_WRITERS - 1) * ENTRIES;
370       int firstHalfEntries = (int) Math.ceil(ENTRIES / 2) - 1;
371       assertTrue("The file up to the corrupted area hasn't been parsed",
372               goodEntries + firstHalfEntries <= countHLog(logfile, fs, conf));
373     }
374   }

376   @Test
377   public void testCorruptedFileGetsArchivedIfSkipErrors() throws IOException {
378     conf.setBoolean(HBASE_SKIP_ERRORS, true);
379     Class<?> backupClass = conf.getClass("hbase.regionserver.hlog.reader.impl",
380         Reader.class);
381     InstrumentedSequenceFileLogWriter.activateFailure = false;
382     HLog.resetLogReaderClass();
383 
384     try {
385     Path c1 = new Path(hlogDir, HLOG_FILE_PREFIX + "0");
386       conf.setClass("hbase.regionserver.hlog.reader.impl",
387           FaultySequenceFileLogReader.class, HLog.Reader.class);
388       for (FaultySequenceFileLogReader.FailureType  failureType : FaultySequenceFileLogReader.FailureType.values()) {
389         conf.set("faultysequencefilelogreader.failuretype", failureType.name());
390         generateHLogs(1, ENTRIES, -1);
391         fs.initialize(fs.getUri(), conf);
392         HLogSplitter logSplitter = HLogSplitter.createLogSplitter(conf,
393             hbaseDir, hlogDir, oldLogDir, fs);
394         logSplitter.splitLog();
395         FileStatus[] archivedLogs = fs.listStatus(corruptDir);
396         assertEquals("expected a different file", c1.getName(), archivedLogs[0]
397             .getPath().getName());
398         assertEquals(archivedLogs.length, 1);
399         fs.delete(new Path(oldLogDir, HLOG_FILE_PREFIX + "0"), false);
400       }
401     } finally {
402       conf.setClass("hbase.regionserver.hlog.reader.impl", backupClass,
403           Reader.class);
404       HLog.resetLogReaderClass();
405     }
406   }

435   public void testCorruptedLogFilesSkipErrorsFalseDoesNotTouchLogs()
436       throws IOException {
437     conf.setBoolean(HBASE_SKIP_ERRORS, false);
438     Class<?> backupClass = conf.getClass("hbase.regionserver.hlog.reader.impl",
439         Reader.class);
440     InstrumentedSequenceFileLogWriter.activateFailure = false;
441     HLog.resetLogReaderClass();
442 
443     try {
444       conf.setClass("hbase.regionserver.hlog.reader.impl",
445           FaultySequenceFileLogReader.class, HLog.Reader.class);
446       conf.set("faultysequencefilelogreader.failuretype", FaultySequenceFileLogReader.FailureType.BEGINNING.name());
447       generateHLogs(-1);

449       HLogSplitter logSplitter = HLogSplitter.createLogSplitter(conf,

466   @Test
467   public void testEOFisIgnored() throws IOException {
468     conf.setBoolean(HBASE_SKIP_ERRORS, false);
469 
470     final String REGION = "region__1";
471     regions.removeAll(regions);
472     regions.add(REGION);
473 
474     int entryCount = 10;
475     Path c1 = new Path(hlogDir, HLOG_FILE_PREFIX + "0");
476     generateHLogs(1, entryCount, -1);
477     corruptHLog(c1, Corruptions.TRUNCATE, true, fs);
478 
479     fs.initialize(fs.getUri(), conf);
480     HLogSplitter logSplitter = HLogSplitter.createLogSplitter(conf,
481         hbaseDir, hlogDir, oldLogDir, fs);
482     logSplitter.splitLog();
483 
484     Path originalLog = (fs.listStatus(oldLogDir))[0].getPath();
485     Path splitLog = getLogForRegion(hbaseDir, TABLE_NAME, REGION);
486 
487     int actualCount = 0;
488     HLog.Reader in = HLog.getReader(fs, splitLog, conf);
489     HLog.Entry entry;
490     while ((entry = in.next()) != null) ++actualCount;
491     assertEquals(entryCount-1, actualCount);
492 
493     // should not have stored the EOF files as corrupt
494     FileStatus[] archivedLogs = fs.listStatus(corruptDir);
495     assertEquals(archivedLogs.length, 0);
496   }

579   @Test
580   public void testSplitWillNotTouchLogsIfNewHLogGetsCreatedAfterSplitStarted()
581   throws IOException {
582     AtomicBoolean stop = new AtomicBoolean(false);
583     generateHLogs(-1);
584     fs.initialize(fs.getUri(), conf);
585     Thread zombie = new ZombieNewLogWriterRegionServer(stop);
586 
587     try {
588       zombie.start();
589       try {
590         HLogSplitter logSplitter = HLogSplitter.createLogSplitter(conf,
591             hbaseDir, hlogDir, oldLogDir, fs);
592         logSplitter.splitLog();
593       } catch (IOException ex) {/* expected */}
594       int logFilesNumber = fs.listStatus(hlogDir).length;
595 
596       assertEquals("Log files should not be archived if there's an extra file after split",
597               NUM_WRITERS + 1, logFilesNumber);
598     } finally {
599       stop.set(true);
600     }
601 
602   }

606   @Test(expected = IOException.class)
607   public void testSplitWillFailIfWritingToRegionFails() throws Exception {
608     //leave 5th log open so we could append the "trap"
609     generateHLogs(4);
610 
611     fs.initialize(fs.getUri(), conf);
612 
613     String region = "break";
614     Path regiondir = new Path(tabledir, region);
615     fs.mkdirs(regiondir);
616 
617     InstrumentedSequenceFileLogWriter.activateFailure = false;
618     appendEntry(writer[4], TABLE_NAME, Bytes.toBytes(region),
619         ("r" + 999).getBytes(), FAMILY, QUALIFIER, VALUE, 0);
620     writer[4].close();
621 
622     try {
623       InstrumentedSequenceFileLogWriter.activateFailure = true;
624       HLogSplitter logSplitter = HLogSplitter.createLogSplitter(conf,
625           hbaseDir, hlogDir, oldLogDir, fs);
626       logSplitter.splitLog();
627 
628     } catch (IOException e) {
629       assertEquals("This exception is instrumented and should only be thrown for testing", e.getMessage());
630       throw e;
631     } finally {
632       InstrumentedSequenceFileLogWriter.activateFailure = false;
633     }

742   @Test
743   public void testRetryOpenDuringRecovery() throws Exception {
744     generateHLogs(-1);
745 
746     fs.initialize(fs.getUri(), conf);
747 
748     FileSystem spiedFs = Mockito.spy(fs);
749     // The "Cannot obtain block length", "Could not obtain the last block",
750     // and "Blocklist for [^ ]* has changed.*" part is very important,
751     // that's how it comes out of HDFS. If HDFS changes the exception
752     // message, this test needs to be adjusted accordingly.
753     //
754     // When DFSClient tries to open a file, HDFS needs to locate
755     // the last block of the file and get its length. However, if the
756     // last block is under recovery, HDFS may have problem to obtain
757     // the block length, in which case, retry may help.
758     Mockito.doAnswer(new Answer<FSDataInputStream>() {
759       private int count = 0;
760       private final String[] errors = new String[] {
761         "Cannot obtain block length", "Could not obtain the last block",
762         "Blocklist for " + oldLogDir + " has changed"};
763 
764       public FSDataInputStream answer(InvocationOnMock invocation) throws Throwable {
765             if (count < 3) {
766                 throw new IOException(errors[count++]);
767             }
768             return (FSDataInputStream)invocation.callRealMethod();
769         }
770     }).when(spiedFs).open(Mockito.<Path>any(), Mockito.anyInt());
771 
772     HLogSplitter logSplitter = new HLogSplitter(
773         conf, hbaseDir, hlogDir, oldLogDir, spiedFs);
774 
775     try {
776       logSplitter.splitLog();
777       assertEquals(NUM_WRITERS, fs.listStatus(oldLogDir).length);
778       assertFalse(fs.exists(hlogDir));
779     } catch (IOException e) {
780       fail("There shouldn't be any exception but: " + e.toString());
781     }
782   }

841   /**
842    * Sets up a log splitter with a mock reader and writer. The mock reader generates
843    * a specified number of edits spread across 5 regions. The mock writer optionally
844    * sleeps for each edit it is fed.
845    * *
846    * After the split is complete, verifies that the statistics show the correct number
847    * of edits output into each region.
848    *
849    * @param numFakeEdits number of fake edits to push through pipeline
850    * @param bufferSize size of in-memory buffer
851    * @param writerSlowness writer threads will sleep this many ms per edit
852    */
853   private void doTestThreading(final int numFakeEdits,
854       final int bufferSize,
855       final int writerSlowness) throws Exception {
856 
857     Configuration localConf = new Configuration(conf);
858     localConf.setInt("hbase.regionserver.hlog.splitlog.buffersize", bufferSize);
859 
860     // Create a fake log file (we'll override the reader to produce a stream of edits)
861     FSDataOutputStream out = fs.create(new Path(hlogDir, HLOG_FILE_PREFIX + ".fake"));
862     out.close();
863 
864     // Make region dirs for our destination regions so the output doesn't get skipped
865     final List<String> regions = ImmutableList.of("r0", "r1", "r2", "r3", "r4");
866     makeRegionDirs(fs, regions);
867 
868     // Create a splitter that reads and writes the data without touching disk
869     HLogSplitter logSplitter = new HLogSplitter(
870         localConf, hbaseDir, hlogDir, oldLogDir, fs) {
871 
872       /* Produce a mock writer that doesn't write anywhere */
873       protected HLog.Writer createWriter(FileSystem fs, Path logfile, Configuration conf)
874       throws IOException {
875         HLog.Writer mockWriter = Mockito.mock(HLog.Writer.class);
876         Mockito.doAnswer(new Answer<Void>() {
877           int expectedIndex = 0;
878 
879           @Override
880           public Void answer(InvocationOnMock invocation) {
881             if (writerSlowness > 0) {
882               try {
883                 Thread.sleep(writerSlowness);
884               } catch (InterruptedException ie) {
885                 Thread.currentThread().interrupt();
886               }
887             }
888             HLog.Entry entry = (Entry) invocation.getArguments()[0];
889             WALEdit edit = entry.getEdit();
890             List<KeyValue> keyValues = edit.getKeyValues();
891             assertEquals(1, keyValues.size());
892             KeyValue kv = keyValues.get(0);
893 
894             // Check that the edits come in the right order.
895             assertEquals(expectedIndex, Bytes.toInt(kv.getRow()));
896             expectedIndex++;
897             return null;
898           }
899         }).when(mockWriter).append(Mockito.<HLog.Entry>any());
900         return mockWriter;
901       }
902 
903 
904       /* Produce a mock reader that generates fake entries */
905       protected Reader getReader(FileSystem fs, Path curLogFile,
906           Configuration conf, CancelableProgressable reporter) throws IOException {
907         Reader mockReader = Mockito.mock(Reader.class);
908         Mockito.doAnswer(new Answer<HLog.Entry>() {
909           int index = 0;
910 
911           @Override
912           public HLog.Entry answer(InvocationOnMock invocation) throws Throwable {
913             if (index >= numFakeEdits) return null;
914 
915             // Generate r0 through r4 in round robin fashion
916             int regionIdx = index % regions.size();
917             byte region[] = new byte[] {(byte)'r', (byte) (0x30 + regionIdx)};
918 
919             HLog.Entry ret = createTestEntry(TABLE_NAME, region,
920                 Bytes.toBytes((int)(index / regions.size())),
921                 FAMILY, QUALIFIER, VALUE, index);
922             index++;
923             return ret;
924           }
925         }).when(mockReader).next();
926         return mockReader;
927       }
928     };
929 
930     logSplitter.splitLog();
931 
932     // Verify number of written edits per region
933 
934     Map<byte[], Long> outputCounts = logSplitter.getOutputCounts();
935     for (Map.Entry<byte[], Long> entry : outputCounts.entrySet()) {
936       LOG.info("Got " + entry.getValue() + " output edits for region " +
937           Bytes.toString(entry.getKey()));
938 
939       assertEquals((long)entry.getValue(), numFakeEdits / regions.size());
940     }
941     assertEquals(regions.size(), outputCounts.size());
942   }

944   // HBASE-2312: tests the case where a RegionServer enters a GC pause,
945   // comes back online after the master declared it dead and started to split.
946   // Want log rolling after a master split to fail
947   @Test
948   @Ignore("Need HADOOP-6886, HADOOP-6840, & HDFS-617 for this. HDFS 0.20.205.1+ should have this")
949   public void testLogRollAfterSplitStart() throws IOException {
950     // set flush interval to a large number so it doesn't interrupt us
951     final String F_INTERVAL = "hbase.regionserver.optionallogflushinterval";
952     long oldFlushInterval = conf.getLong(F_INTERVAL, 1000);
953     conf.setLong(F_INTERVAL, 1000*1000*100);
954     HLog log = null;
955     Path thisTestsDir = new Path(hbaseDir, "testLogRollAfterSplitStart");
956 
957     try {
958       // put some entries in an HLog
959       byte [] tableName = Bytes.toBytes(this.getClass().getName());
960       HRegionInfo regioninfo = new HRegionInfo(tableName,
961           HConstants.EMPTY_START_ROW, HConstants.EMPTY_END_ROW);
962       log = new HLog(fs, thisTestsDir, oldLogDir, conf);
963       final int total = 20;
964       for (int i = 0; i < total; i++) {
965         WALEdit kvs = new WALEdit();
966         kvs.add(new KeyValue(Bytes.toBytes(i), tableName, tableName));
967         HTableDescriptor htd = new HTableDescriptor(tableName);
968         htd.addFamily(new HColumnDescriptor("column"));
969         log.append(regioninfo, tableName, kvs, System.currentTimeMillis(), htd);
970       }
971       // Send the data to HDFS datanodes and close the HDFS writer
972       log.sync();
973       log.cleanupCurrentWriter(log.getFilenum());
974 
975       /* code taken from ProcessServerShutdown.process()
976        * handles RS shutdowns (as observed by the Master)
977        */
978       // rename the directory so a rogue RS doesn't create more HLogs
979       Path rsSplitDir = new Path(thisTestsDir.getParent(),
980                                  thisTestsDir.getName() + "-splitting");
981       fs.rename(thisTestsDir, rsSplitDir);
982       LOG.debug("Renamed region directory: " + rsSplitDir);
983 
984       // Process the old log files
985       HLogSplitter splitter = HLogSplitter.createLogSplitter(conf,
986         hbaseDir, rsSplitDir, oldLogDir, fs);
987       splitter.splitLog();
988 
989       // Now, try to roll the HLog and verify failure
990       try {
991         log.rollWriter();
992         Assert.fail("rollWriter() did not throw any exception.");
993       } catch (IOException ioe) {
994         if (ioe.getCause().getMessage().contains("FileNotFound")) {
995           LOG.info("Got the expected exception: ", ioe.getCause());
996         } else {
997           Assert.fail("Unexpected exception: " + ioe);
998         }
999       }
1000     } finally {
1001       conf.setLong(F_INTERVAL, oldFlushInterval);
1002       if (log != null) {
1003         log.close();
1004       }
1005       if (fs.exists(thisTestsDir)) {
1006         fs.delete(thisTestsDir, true);
1007       }
1008     }
1009   }

1011   /**
1012    * This thread will keep writing to the file after the split process has started
1013    * It simulates a region server that was considered dead but woke up and wrote
1014    * some more to he last log entry
1015    */
1016   class ZombieLastLogWriterRegionServer extends Thread {
1017     AtomicLong editsCount;
1018     AtomicBoolean stop;
1019     Path log;
1020     HLog.Writer lastLogWriter;
1021     public ZombieLastLogWriterRegionServer(HLog.Writer writer, AtomicLong counter, AtomicBoolean stop) {
1022       this.stop = stop;
1023       this.editsCount = counter;
1024       this.lastLogWriter = writer;
1025     }
1026 
1027     @Override
1028     public void run() {
1029       if (stop.get()){
1030         return;
1031       }
1032       flushToConsole("starting");
1033       while (true) {
1034         try {
1035           String region = "juliet";
1036 
1037           fs.mkdirs(new Path(new Path(hbaseDir, region), region));
1038           appendEntry(lastLogWriter, TABLE_NAME, region.getBytes(),
1039                   ("r" + editsCount).getBytes(), FAMILY, QUALIFIER, VALUE, 0);
1040           lastLogWriter.sync();
1041           editsCount.incrementAndGet();
1042           try {
1043             Thread.sleep(1);
1044           } catch (InterruptedException e) {
1045             //
1046           }
1047 
1048 
1049         } catch (IOException ex) {
1050           if (ex instanceof RemoteException) {
1051             flushToConsole("Juliet: got RemoteException " +
1052                     ex.getMessage() + " while writing " + (editsCount.get() + 1));
1053             break;
1054           } else {
1055             assertTrue("Failed to write " + editsCount.get(), false);
1056           }
1057 
1058         }
1059       }
1060 
1061 
1062     }
1063   }

1065   /**
1066    * This thread will keep adding new log files
1067    * It simulates a region server that was considered dead but woke up and wrote
1068    * some more to a new hlog
1069    */
1070   class ZombieNewLogWriterRegionServer extends Thread {
1071     AtomicBoolean stop;
1072     public ZombieNewLogWriterRegionServer(AtomicBoolean stop) {
1073       super("ZombieNewLogWriterRegionServer");
1074       this.stop = stop;
1075     }
1076 
1077     @Override
1078     public void run() {
1079       if (stop.get()) {
1080         return;
1081       }
1082       Path tableDir = new Path(hbaseDir, new String(TABLE_NAME));
1083       Path regionDir = new Path(tableDir, regions.get(0));
1084       Path recoveredEdits = new Path(regionDir, HLogSplitter.RECOVERED_EDITS);
1085       String region = "juliet";
1086       Path julietLog = new Path(hlogDir, HLOG_FILE_PREFIX + ".juliet");
1087       try {
1088 
1089         while (!fs.exists(recoveredEdits) && !stop.get()) {
1090           flushToConsole("Juliet: split not started, sleeping a bit...");
1091           Threads.sleep(10);
1092         }
1093  
1094         fs.mkdirs(new Path(tableDir, region));
1095         HLog.Writer writer = HLog.createWriter(fs,
1096             julietLog, conf);
1097         appendEntry(writer, "juliet".getBytes(), ("juliet").getBytes(),
1098             ("r").getBytes(), FAMILY, QUALIFIER, VALUE, 0);
1099         writer.close();
1100         flushToConsole("Juliet file creator: created file " + julietLog);
1101       } catch (IOException e1) {
1102         assertTrue("Failed to create file " + julietLog, false);
1103       }
1104     }
1105   }

1221   /**
1222    * @throws IOException
1223    * @see https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/HBASE-4862
1224    */
1225   @Test
1226   public void testConcurrentSplitLogAndReplayRecoverEdit() throws IOException {
1227     LOG.info("testConcurrentSplitLogAndReplayRecoverEdit");
1228     // Generate hlogs for our destination region
1229     String regionName = "r0";
1230     final Path regiondir = new Path(tabledir, regionName);
1231     regions = new ArrayList<String>();
1232     regions.add(regionName);
1233     generateHLogs(-1);
1234 
1235     HLogSplitter logSplitter = new HLogSplitter(
1236         conf, hbaseDir, hlogDir, oldLogDir, fs) {
1237       protected HLog.Writer createWriter(FileSystem fs, Path logfile, Configuration conf)
1238       throws IOException {
1239         HLog.Writer writer = HLog.createWriter(fs, logfile, conf);
1240         // After creating writer, simulate region's
1241         // replayRecoveredEditsIfAny() which gets SplitEditFiles of this
1242         // region and delete them, excluding files with '.temp' suffix.
1243         NavigableSet<Path> files = HLog.getSplitEditFilesSorted(this.fs,
1244             regiondir);
1245         if (files != null && !files.isEmpty()) {
1246           for (Path file : files) {
1247             if (!this.fs.delete(file, false)) {
1248               LOG.error("Failed delete of " + file);
1249             } else {
1250               LOG.debug("Deleted recovered.edits file=" + file);
1251             }
1252           }
1253         }
1254         return writer;
1255       }
1256     };
1257     try{
1258       logSplitter.splitLog();
1259     } catch (IOException e) {
1260       LOG.info(e);
1261       Assert.fail("Throws IOException when spliting "
1262           + "log, it is most likely because writing file does not "
1263           + "exist which is caused by concurrent replayRecoveredEditsIfAny()");
1264     }
1265     if (fs.exists(corruptDir)) {
1266       if (fs.listStatus(corruptDir).length > 0) {
1267         Assert.fail("There are some corrupt logs, "
1268                 + "it is most likely caused by concurrent replayRecoveredEditsIfAny()");
1269       }
1270     }
1271   }

1290   private void generateHLogs(int writers, int entries, int leaveOpen) throws IOException {
1291     makeRegionDirs(fs, regions);
1292     fs.mkdirs(hlogDir);
1293     for (int i = 0; i < writers; i++) {
1294       writer[i] = HLog.createWriter(fs, new Path(hlogDir, HLOG_FILE_PREFIX + i), conf);
1295       for (int j = 0; j < entries; j++) {
1296         int prefix = 0;
1297         for (String region : regions) {
1298           String row_key = region + prefix++ + i + j;
1299           appendEntry(writer[i], TABLE_NAME, region.getBytes(),
1300                   row_key.getBytes(), FAMILY, QUALIFIER, VALUE, seq);
1301         }
1302       }
1303       if (i != leaveOpen) {
1304         writer[i].close();
1305         flushToConsole("Closing writer " + i);
1306       }
1307     }
1308   }

1320   private void corruptHLog(Path path, Corruptions corruption, boolean close,
1321                            FileSystem fs) throws IOException {
1322 
1323     FSDataOutputStream out;
1324     int fileSize = (int) fs.listStatus(path)[0].getLen();
1325 
1326     FSDataInputStream in = fs.open(path);
1327     byte[] corrupted_bytes = new byte[fileSize];
1328     in.readFully(0, corrupted_bytes, 0, fileSize);
1329     in.close();
1330 
1331     switch (corruption) {
1332       case APPEND_GARBAGE:
1333         fs.delete(path, false);
1334         out = fs.create(path);
1335         out.write(corrupted_bytes);
1336         out.write("-----".getBytes());
1337         closeOrFlush(close, out);
1338         break;
1339 
1340       case INSERT_GARBAGE_ON_FIRST_LINE:
1341         fs.delete(path, false);
1342         out = fs.create(path);
1343         out.write(0);
1344         out.write(corrupted_bytes);
1345         closeOrFlush(close, out);
1346         break;
1347 
1348       case INSERT_GARBAGE_IN_THE_MIDDLE:
1349         fs.delete(path, false);
1350         out = fs.create(path);
1351         int middle = (int) Math.floor(corrupted_bytes.length / 2);
1352         out.write(corrupted_bytes, 0, middle);
1353         out.write(0);
1354         out.write(corrupted_bytes, middle, corrupted_bytes.length - middle);
1355         closeOrFlush(close, out);
1356         break;
1357 
1358       case TRUNCATE:
1359         fs.delete(path, false);
1360         out = fs.create(path);
1361         out.write(corrupted_bytes, 0, fileSize-32);
1362         closeOrFlush(close, out);
1363 
1364         break;
1365     }
1366   }
1367 
1368   private void closeOrFlush(boolean close, FSDataOutputStream out)
1369   throws IOException {
1370     if (close) {
1371       out.close();
1372     } else {
1373       Method syncMethod = null;
1374       try {
1375         syncMethod = out.getClass().getMethod("hflush", new Class<?> []{});
1376       } catch (NoSuchMethodException e) {
1377         try {
1378           syncMethod = out.getClass().getMethod("sync", new Class<?> []{});
1379         } catch (NoSuchMethodException ex) {
1380           throw new IOException("This version of Hadoop supports " +
1381               "neither Syncable.sync() nor Syncable.hflush().");
1382         }
1383       }
1384       try {
1385         syncMethod.invoke(out, new Object[]{});
1386       } catch (Exception e) {
1387         throw new IOException(e);
1388       }
1389       // Not in 0out.hflush();
1390     }
1391   }

1412   public long appendEntry(HLog.Writer writer, byte[] table, byte[] region,
1413                           byte[] row, byte[] family, byte[] qualifier,
1414                           byte[] value, long seq)
1415           throws IOException {
1416 
1417     writer.append(createTestEntry(table, region, row, family, qualifier, value, seq));
1418     writer.sync();
1419     return seq;
1420   }

1422   private HLog.Entry createTestEntry(
1423       byte[] table, byte[] region,
1424       byte[] row, byte[] family, byte[] qualifier,
1425       byte[] value, long seq) {
1426     long time = System.nanoTime();
1427     WALEdit edit = new WALEdit();
1428     seq++;
1429     edit.add(new KeyValue(row, family, qualifier, time, KeyValue.Type.Put, value));
1430     return new HLog.Entry(new HLogKey(region, table, seq, time,
1431         HConstants.DEFAULT_CLUSTER_ID), edit);
1432   }

1450   private int compareHLogSplitDirs(Path p1, Path p2) throws IOException {
1451     FileStatus[] f1 = fs.listStatus(p1);
1452     FileStatus[] f2 = fs.listStatus(p2);
1453     assertNotNull("Path " + p1 + " doesn't exist", f1);
1454     assertNotNull("Path " + p2 + " doesn't exist", f2);
1455 
1456     System.out.println("Files in " + p1 + ": " +
1457         Joiner.on(",").join(FileUtil.stat2Paths(f1)));
1458     System.out.println("Files in " + p2 + ": " +
1459         Joiner.on(",").join(FileUtil.stat2Paths(f2)));
1460     assertEquals(f1.length, f2.length);
1461 
1462     for (int i = 0; i < f1.length; i++) {
1463       // Regions now have a directory named RECOVERED_EDITS_DIR and in here
1464       // are split edit files. In below presume only 1.
1465       Path rd1 = HLog.getRegionDirRecoveredEditsDir(f1[i].getPath());
1466       FileStatus[] rd1fs = fs.listStatus(rd1);
1467       assertEquals(1, rd1fs.length);
1468       Path rd2 = HLog.getRegionDirRecoveredEditsDir(f2[i].getPath());
1469       FileStatus[] rd2fs = fs.listStatus(rd2);
1470       assertEquals(1, rd2fs.length);
1471       if (!logsAreEqual(rd1fs[0].getPath(), rd2fs[0].getPath())) {
1472         return -1;
1473       }
1474     }
1475     return 0;
1476   }

1478   private boolean logsAreEqual(Path p1, Path p2) throws IOException {
1479     HLog.Reader in1, in2;
1480     in1 = HLog.getReader(fs, p1, conf);
1481     in2 = HLog.getReader(fs, p2, conf);
1482     HLog.Entry entry1;
1483     HLog.Entry entry2;
1484     while ((entry1 = in1.next()) != null) {
1485       entry2 = in2.next();
1486       if ((entry1.getKey().compareTo(entry2.getKey()) != 0) ||
1487               (!entry1.getEdit().toString().equals(entry2.getEdit().toString()))) {
1488         return false;
1489       }
1490     }
1491     return true;
1492   }
